page.title: 04LUNS HOUSE FARM
page.content: At Luns House Farm we were introduced to the farmer,we were then shown the cows and sheep.then he opened one poultry house which keeps hens in.In one poultry house there were hens ten months and in the other one they were about sx months old. There were 1500 hens in one shed and each hen lays one egg per day.Altogether they lay 1200 eggs per day.The hens when fifteen months old are killed.The chicks are brought in at one day and start laying eggs at five months old.After hens have laid their eggs they are put into the right sizes by their weight.They are then sold at corner shops,by milkmen and also bought by people passing by the farm.
